meanings.definition: A word or words by which an entity is designated and distinguished from others.
meanings.sent1: The named of the company was unique and stood out.
meanings.sent2: I always remember the named of my favorite book.
meanings.sent3: The named of the cat was so long that it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her named was like a beacon in the sea of faces.
meanings.sent5: The named of the mountain was so grand that it echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent2: The explorer named the newly discovered island after himself.
meanings.sent3: He named his car 'Speedy' even though it was slow.
meanings.sent4: The chef named his signature dish 'Flaming Delight'.
meanings.sent5: The author named her characters with great care to reflect their personalities.

meanings.definition: To mention or identify by name.
meanings.sent1: She named all the ingredients in the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The witness named the suspect in the police lineup.
meanings.sent3: He named his favorite movie star during the interview.
meanings.sent4: The historian named the ancient civilization in his research paper.
meanings.sent5: The teacher named the student who answered the question correctly.
